abstract: Markets achieve new nominal highs after Federal Reserve indicates patience about raising interest rates.
lead_paragraph: Stocks edged higher as Investors cheered new signals that the Fed is unlikely to raise interest rates soon and news that Greece’s creditors approved another bailout.

headline.main: Encouraging News on Interest Rates and Greece Sends the Market Up
headline.print_headline: Optimism Over Interest Rates and Greek Bailout Pushes Indexes to New Peaks

snippet: Stocks edged higher as Investors cheered new signals that the Fed is unlikely to raise interest rates soon and news that Greece’s creditors approved another bailout.
